text: workflows pxmake, starts way: using px() create px object. using built dataset population_gl. create px object, simply pass data set px() function. x now px object. word object just means px file stored specific format functions pxmake package uses. Use px_save() save px object px file. Since provided metadata, px() added minimal set metadata, necessary creating valid px file. resulting px file can seen .
code: library(pxmake)  population_gl |>   head(10) |>   print() #>    gender   age year     n #> 1    male   0-6 2004  3237 #> 2    male   0-6 2014  2950 #> 3    male   0-6 2024  2769 #> 4    male  7-16 2004  5085 #> 5    male  7-16 2014  4040 #> 6    male  7-16 2024  3865 #> 7    male 17-24 2004  3191 #> 8    male 17-24 2014  3614 #> 9    male 17-24 2024  2940 #> 10   male 25-64 2004 17328 x <- px(population_gl) px_save(x, "population_gl.px") CHARSET="ANSI"; DECIMALS=0; MATRIX=""; SUBJECT-CODE=""; SUBJECT-AREA=""; TITLE=""; CONTENTS=""; UNITS=""; STUB="gender","age"; HEADING="year"; VALUES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; VALUES("gender")="female","male"; VALUES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; CODES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; CODES("gender")="female","male"; CODES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; VARIABLECODE("age")="age"; VARIABLECODE("gender")="gender"; VARIABLECODE("n")="n"; VARIABLECODE("year")="year"; DATA= 3109 2644 2668 3003 3528 2862 13744 14397 15098 1630 2004 2616 5018 3979 3534 3237 2950 2769 3191 3614 2940 17328 16888 17231 1481 2238 3116 5085 4040 3865 ;

title: Metadata for Research
code: # cran library(tidyverse) library(janitor) library(lubridate) library(arrow) library(cprr)  # github # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("StatisticsGreenland/pxmake") library(pxmake) # devtools::install_github("StatisticsGreenland/statgl") library(statgl)  # local path pgmPath <- file.path("S:","STATFACT","GSpakker","pxmake","vignette","mikro")  # parameter reference_date <- as.Date("2024-01-01")    # helpers ################# # By chatGPT: # can you convert code on this page to r?  # "https://blog.ploeh.dk/2018/12/10/danish-cpr-numbers-in-f/" # # With a few extra iterations chatGPT offered #  # Define the CprNumber class CprNumber <- function(day, month, year, sequenceNumber) {   list(day = day, month = month, year = year, sequenceNumber = sequenceNumber) }  # Convert CprNumber to string cprToString <- function(cpr) {   sprintf("%02d%02d%02d-%04d", cpr$day, cpr$month, cpr$year, cpr$sequenceNumber) }  # Calculate the four-digit year calculateFourDigitYear <- function(year, sequenceNumber) {   centuryDigit <- sequenceNumber %/% 1000   century <- switch(centuryDigit + 1,     "1900", "1900", "1900", "1900", # For centuryDigit 0 to 3     if (year <= 36) "2000" else "1900", # For centuryDigit 4     if (year <= 57) "2000" else "1800", # For centuryDigit 5 to 8     "2000", "2000", "2000", "2000", # For centuryDigit 9 (and above if needed)     if (year <= 36) "2000" else "1900" # Default case   )   as.integer(century) + year }  # Try to create a CprNumber tryCreate <- function(day, month, year, sequenceNumber) {   if (month >= 1 && month <= 12 &&       year >= 0 && year <= 99 &&       sequenceNumber >= 0 && sequenceNumber <= 9999) {     fourDigitYear <- calculateFourDigitYear(year, sequenceNumber)     if (day >= 1 && day <= days_in_month(ymd(sprintf("%04d-%02d-01", fourDigitYear, month)))) {       return(CprNumber(day, month, year, sequenceNumber))     }   }   return(NULL) }  # Generate CPR number generateCPR <- function(birthdate, sequence, sex) {   day <- day(birthdate)   month <- month(birthdate)   year <- year(birthdate) %% 100   sexDigit <- ifelse(sex == 0, 0, 1)   sequenceNumber <- sequence * 10 + sexDigit      cpr <- tryCreate(day, month, year, sequenceNumber)   if (!is.null(cpr)) {     return(cprToString(cpr))   } else {     return("Invalid CPR parameters")   } }  # # Example usage # birthdate <- as.Date("2003-01-02") # sequence <- 123 # sex <- 1 # generateCPR(birthdate, sequence, sex)  #################  # helper function copy2clipboard <- function(x,row.names=FALSE,col.names=FALSE,...) {   write.table(x,"clipboard",dec = ",", sep="\t", row.names=row.names, col.names=col.names,...) } # %>% filter(grp=="4" & sex=="F" & age=="33" & area=="956") # %>% copy2clipboard # %>% view()  ######################################### # # first time creation of a px-file takes a lot of time to get translated metadata # # BUT a lot is already translated to Greenlandic and English # # these helpers gets some metadata from any Statbank table # #########################################   get_codelist <- function(table_id, langs = c("en", "kl", "da")) {   enframe(langs, name = NULL, value = "langs") %>%      mutate(try = map2_chr(table_id, langs, statgl_url) %>%               purrr::map(statgl_meta) %>%               purrr::map(pluck,"variables")            ) %>%      unnest(try) %>%      unnest(c(values, valueTexts)) %>%      select(variable = code,            `variable-code` = text,            code = values,            language = langs,            value = valueTexts) %>%     group_by(variable,language) %>%     mutate(order = row_number()) }  # try to get code labels for a variable codelist_age <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="age") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value,order)  get_variable_labels <- function(table_id, langs = c("en", "kl", "da")) {   enframe(langs, name = NULL, value = "langs") %>%      mutate(try = map2_chr(table_id, langs, statgl_url) %>%               purrr::map(statgl_meta) %>%               purrr::map(pluck,"variables")            ) %>%      unnest(try) %>%      unnest(c(values, valueTexts)) %>%      select(`variable-label` = text,            `variable-code` = code,            language = langs) %>%      unique() }  # try to get the variable labels for the table var_label_time <- get_variable_labels("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(`variable-code`=="time")

what: A population table from Statbank Greenland as a tidy dataset
title: Metadata for Research
code: # get latest January 1st. Population count from # Statbank Greenland as a tidy dataset & # add fictive birthdates, sequences to generate PIN   syntpop <- statgl_fetch("BEXSTA", time=px_top(1),                          .col_code=T, .val_code=T, .eliminate_rest = F) %>%    clean_names() %>%    filter(place_of_birth!="T" &             gender!="T" &             residence_type!="T" &             value!=0) %>%    uncount(value) %>%    mutate(age=strtoi(age)) %>%    group_by(age) %>%   mutate(tally = rep(1:365, length.out = n())) %>%   ungroup() %>%    mutate(yob=strtoi(time)-age-1,   dob = ymd(paste0(yob, "-01-01")) + days(tally - 1)) %>%    group_by(dob) %>%   mutate(pr_day = rep(1:365, length.out = n())) %>%   ungroup() %>%    select(time,place_of_birth,residence_type, gender,dob,pr_day) %>%    mutate(lbnr = ifelse(year(dob) >= 1900 & year(dob) <= 1999,                        300 + pr_day,                        ifelse(year(dob) < 1900,                               500 + pr_day,                               900 + pr_day))) %>%    select(-pr_day)

title: Metadata for Research
text: deliberately small sample, information snapshot, specific point time - reference date. Included PIN compressed basic details clarity birthplace address. practice, CPR system delivers extensive data, including detailed address information, event dates, event types, much . received, raw data checked errors. variable codes, known, PIN shall valid, values shall within acceptance bounds, etc. Deviated variables, like age gender, calculated, using cran package cprr. Contents 2 variables ‘place birth’ ‘residence type’ matched code/text formats, making sure, known values. missing, data needs attention. Reference_date sepecial variable stored typically formatted year annual statistics. Time crucial understand dataset. Finally microdata stored parquet file disk, ready dissemination.
code: CPR_data <- syntpop %>%   mutate(     birth_year=year(dob),     birth_date=dob,     sex=as.integer(ifelse(gender=="M",1,0)),     PIN = mapply(generateCPR, birth_date, sequence=lbnr, sex)   ) %>%   select(PIN,place_of_birth,residence_type) %>%    arrange(PIN,place_of_birth,residence_type)  CPR_data %>% sample_n(5) %>% statgl_table() fmt_pob = tribble(~place_of_birth,~place_of_birth_txt,                   "N","Born in Greenland",                   "S","Born outside Greenland")  fmt_res = tribble(~residence_type,~residence_type_txt,                   "A","Capital city",                   "B","Main settlements",                   "C","Larger settlements",                   "D","Settlements",                   "E","Smaller settlements",                   "F","Smallest settlements",                   "G","Other localities",)  df_raw <- CPR_data %>%    mutate(time=year(reference_date),          dob=dob(PIN),          age=floor(age(PIN,reference_date)),          gender=gender(PIN))  df_check_me <- df_raw %>%    left_join(fmt_pob, by = join_by(place_of_birth)) %>%    left_join(fmt_res, by = join_by(residence_type)) %>%    filter(is.na(place_of_birth_txt) | is.na(residence_type))           # Check if the data frame is empty if (nrow(df_check_me) != 0) {   print(df_check_me) } else {   print("good to continue") }  write_parquet(df_raw,file.path(pgmPath,"data","df_raw.parquet"))  df_raw %>% sample_n(5) %>% statgl_table(year_col="time")

code: # 1st conversion x <- px(df_ready) %>%    px_language("en") %>%                # English is set as mainlanguage   px_languages(c("en","da","kl"))      # and also Danish and Greenlandic shall   # Check to see if numeric columns should be forced to sub px_heading(x) #[1] "age"  x <- px(df_ready) %>%    px_language("en") %>%                # English is set as mainlanguage   px_languages(c("en","da","kl")) %>%  # and also Danish and Greenlandic shall    px_timeval("time") %>%    px_stub("age")  # Second check px_heading(x) #character(0)  # ready for first px-file creation px_micro(x,file.path(pgmPath,"px")) subject <-   tribble(~language, ~value,           "en", "Population",            "da", "Befolkning",            "kl", "Innuttaasut")  creation_date <- "20240801 09:00" last_updated <- "20240811 09:00" next_update   <- "20250801 09:00"  # 2nd conversion x <-   df_ready %>%   pxmake::px() %>%   px_codepage("utf-8") %>%   px_language("en") %>%   px_languages(c("en", "da", "kl")) %>%   px_decimals("0") %>%   px_showdecimals("0") %>%   px_subject_code("BE") %>%    px_subject_area(subject) %>%    px_autopen("YES") %>%          # with only 2 variables, there is no need for selecting   px_stub("age") %>%    px_timeval("time") %>%   px_units(tribble(~language, ~value,                    "en", "Persons",                     "da", "Personer",                     "kl", "Inuit")) %>%   px_update_frequency("Annually") %>%   px_creation_date(creation_date) %>%   px_last_updated(last_updated) %>%   px_next_update(next_update) %>%   px_link("www.stat.gl/bee202401/m1") %>%   px_contact("Lars Pedersen, LARP at STAT.gl") %>%   px_source(tribble(~language, ~value,             "en",  "Statistics Greenland",             "da",  "Grønlands Statistik",             "kl",  "Kalaallit Nunaanni Naatsorsueqqissaartarfik"))   # ready for 2nd px-file creation px_micro(x,file.path(pgmPath,"px")) metadoc <- x$variables2 %>% select(variable=`variable-code`, language) %>%    mutate(px_contents=variable,          px_title=variable,          px_matrix=variable,          px_description=variable,          px_matrix=variable)  # ready for 4th px-file creation px_micro(x,file.path(pgmPath,"px"), keyword_values = metadoc) #hi <- x$cells1  codelist_age <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="age") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value)  codelist_age_order <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="age" & language=="en") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   select(`variable-code`=variable,code,order)  codelist_pob <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="place of birth") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   filter(code!="T") %>%    select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value)  codelist_res <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="residence type") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   filter(code!="T") %>%    select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value)  codelist_gender <- get_codelist("BEXSTA") %>%   filter(variable=="gender") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value)  codelist_dob <- get_codelist("BEXBBDMD1") %>%   filter(variable=="month") %>%    as.data.frame() %>%   mutate(code=sprintf("%02d", as.numeric(code))) %>%    select(`variable-code`=variable,code,language,value)  variable_values <- codelist_age %>%    bind_rows(codelist_pob) %>%    bind_rows(codelist_res) %>%    bind_rows(codelist_gender) %>%    bind_rows(codelist_dob) %>%    mutate(`variable-code`=ifelse(`variable-code`=="place of birth","place_of_birth",`variable-code`),          `variable-code`=ifelse(`variable-code`=="residence type","residence_type",`variable-code`),          `variable-code`=ifelse(`variable-code`=="month","dob",`variable-code`))  x1 <- x %>%    px_values(variable_values) %>%    px_order(codelist_age_order)  # ready for 4th px-file creation px_micro(x1,file.path(pgmPath,"px"), keyword_values = metadoc)

title: Micro files
text: px_micro() exists support specific use case Statistics Greenland. use create small px files showcase present metadata lager data set made publicly available. See example Statistic Greenland’s microdata Research Analysis.

title: Micro files
text: Apart px_save(), px_micro() function can save px objects px files. px_micro() turns px object many smaller px files, containing subset variables original px object.

title: Micro files
text: basis micro files usually data set doesn’t count variable (like px files). px_micro() instead create count individual variable. example use built-data data set greenlanders.
code: library(pxmake)  greenlanders |> dplyr::sample_n(10) |> dplyr::arrange_all() #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    cohort gender   age municipality #>    <chr>  <chr>  <int> <chr>        #>  1 A      female    21 Sermersooq   #>  2 A      female    59 Qeqertalik   #>  3 A      male      24 Kujalleq     #>  4 A      male      48 Qeqqata      #>  5 A      male      63 Avannaata    #>  6 B      female    32 Kujalleq     #>  7 B      female    73 Avannaata    #>  8 B      male      44 Qeqertalik   #>  9 B      male      62 Sermersooq   #> 10 B      male      98 Qeqertalik

title: Micro files
text: Create px object px(), pass px_micro(). folder now contains three px files, one variable except ‘age’. reason ‘age’ didn’t get px file HEADING variable x, px_micro() creates file non-HEADING variable. Instead HEADNING variable used created px files. case, want ‘cohort’ heading, create px file ‘gender’, ‘age’ ‘municipality’. folder now contains files wanted. file contains one three variables STUB, ‘cohort’ HEADING, variable ‘n’ count combination variables.
code: # Create px object x <- px(greenlanders)  # Create folder for micro files micro_dir <- file.path("micro_files") dir.create(micro_dir)  # Write micro files to folder px_micro(x, out_dir = micro_dir) list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "cohort.px"       "gender.px"       "municipality.px" # Print HEADING variables px_heading(x) #> [1] "age"  # Print non-HEADING variables c(px_stub(x), px_figures(x)) #> [1] "cohort"       "gender"       "municipality" x2 <-   x |>   px_stub('age') |>    # Change age to STUB   px_heading('cohort') # Change cohort to HEADING # Clear folder unlink(file.path(micro_dir, "*.px"))  px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir) list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "age.px"          "gender.px"       "municipality.px" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'age.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 120 × 3 #>    age   cohort     n #>    <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1 18    A         NA #>  2 18    B          1 #>  3 19    A         NA #>  4 19    B          1 #>  5 20    A         NA #>  6 20    B          1 #>  7 21    A          3 #>  8 21    B         NA #>  9 22    A          1 #> 10 22    B         NA #> # ℹ 110 more rows  px(file.path(micro_dir, 'gender.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   gender cohort     n #>   <chr>  <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 female A         31 #> 2 female B         18 #> 3 male   A         23 #> 4 male   B         28  px(file.path(micro_dir, 'municipality.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    municipality cohort     n #>    <chr>        <chr>  <dbl> #>  1 Avannaata    A         11 #>  2 Avannaata    B         11 #>  3 Kujalleq     A         12 #>  4 Kujalleq     B          7 #>  5 Qeqertalik   A         13 #>  6 Qeqertalik   B          5 #>  7 Qeqqata      A          9 #>  8 Qeqqata      B         11 #>  9 Sermersooq   A          9 #> 10 Sermersooq   B         12

title: Micro files
text: general keyword values px object carried micro files. case keywords like ‘MATRIX’, ‘SUBJECT-CODE’, ‘CONTACT’, ‘LANGUAGE’, ‘CODEPAGE’, etc. change keywords across micro files, easiest change px object calling px_micro(). However, keywords need changed individually micro file. , create data frame column ‘variable’ column px keyword change. Supply dataframe keyword_values argument px_micro(). DESCRIPTION changed micro files:
code: # Change CONTACT in all micro files x2 |>   px_contact("Johan Ejstrud") |>   px_micro(out_dir = micro_dir) individual_keywords <- tibble::tribble(~variable     ,      ~px_description,                                        "age"         ,    "Age count 18-99",                                        "gender"      ,       "Gender count",                                        "municipality",  "Municipality 2024"                                        ) px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords) px(file.path(micro_dir, 'age.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Age count 18-99" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'gender.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Gender count" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'municipality.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Municipality 2024"

title: Micro files
text: multilingual files add ‘language’ column keyword_values. ‘px_description’ varies language, ‘px_matrix’ set one languages, since language dependent keywords. language independant keywords doesn’t matter language value set .
code: x3 <-   x2 |>   px_language("en") |>   px_languages(c("en", "kl"))   individual_keywords_ml <-    tibble::tribble(        ~variable, ~language,     ~px_description, ~px_matrix,            "age",      "en",   "Age count 18-99",      "AGE",            "age",      "kl",       "Ukiut 18-99",         NA,         "gender",      "en",      "Gender count",      "GEN",         "gender",      "kl",      " Suiaassuseq",         NA,   "municipality",      "en", "Municipality 2024",      "MUN",   "municipality",      "kl",      "Kommuni 2024",         NA   )  px_micro(x3, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords_ml)

title: Micro files
text: filenames micro files default name variable, however can also changed passing ‘filename’ column ‘keyword_values’
code: individual_keywords2 <-    individual_keywords |>   dplyr::mutate(filename = paste0(variable, "_2024", ".px"))  # Clear folder unlink(file.path(micro_dir, "*.px"))  px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords2)  list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "age_2024.px"          "gender_2024.px"       "municipality_2024.px"

title: Statistics Greenland
text: minimal template tables meant presented Statbank Greenland.
code: library(pxmake) library(dplyr) library(stringr) creation_date <- "20240301 09:00" last_updated <- "20240711 09:00" next_update <- "20250301 09:00" year <- "2024" subject <- tribble(~language, ~value, "en", "Population", "da", "Befolkning", "kl", "Innuttaasut") description <- subject %>% mutate(value = str_glue("{value} 1999-{year} [BEEP24MORT]")) x <- population_gl %>% pxmake::px() %>% px_codepage("utf-8") %>% px_language("en") %>% px_languages(c("en", "da", "kl")) %>% px_decimals("15") %>% px_showdecimals("0") %>% px_matrix("POP") %>% px_subject_code("BE") %>% px_subject_area(subject) %>% px_contents(subject) %>% px_stub(c("gender", "age")) %>% px_heading("year") %>% px_timeval("year") %>% px_description(description) %>% px_title(subject) %>% px_units(tribble(~language, ~value, "en", "Persons", "da", "Personer", "kl", "Inuit")) %>% px_domain(tribble(~`variable-code`, ~language, ~domain, "age" , "en", "VPAge", "age" , "da", "VPAlder", "age" , "kl", "VPUkiut")) %>% px_update_frequency("Annually") %>% px_creation_date(creation_date) %>% px_last_updated(last_updated) %>% px_next_update(next_update) %>% px_link("www.stat.gl/bee202401/m1") %>% px_contact("Lars Pedersen, LARP at STAT.gl") %>% px_source(tribble(~language, ~value, "en", "Statistics Greenland", "da", "Grønlands Statistik", "kl", "Kalaallit Nunaanni Naatsorsueqqissaartarfik"))

title: Statistics Greenland
text: px files published Statbank Greenland organized subjects/topics. api (pxweb) exposes information supported language https://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/{language}/Greenland.

title: Statistics Greenland
text: ChatGPT can used generate R code. example, api endpoints adresses subject (codes texts) provided ChatGPT asked : Please combine data fromhttps://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/en/Greenland,https://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/da/Greenland andhttps://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/kl/Greenland one dataframe r add column language, tidyverse, fetch function returned:
code: by ChatGPT  # Load the necessary packages library(httr) library(jsonlite) library(tidyverse)  # Function to fetch data from API and add language column fetch_data <- function(url, language) {   response <- GET(url)   data <- content(response, as = "text")   json_data <- fromJSON(data, flatten = TRUE) %>% as_tibble()   json_data <- json_data %>% mutate(language = language)   return(json_data) }  # URLs for the APIs url_en <- "https://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/en/Greenland" url_da <- "https://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/da/Greenland" url_kl <- "https://bank.stat.gl/api/v1/kl/Greenland"  # Fetch data from each API df_en <- fetch_data(url_en, 'English') df_da <- fetch_data(url_da, 'Danish') df_kl <- fetch_data(url_kl, 'Greenlandic')  # Combine the dataframes combined_df <- bind_rows(df_en, df_da, df_kl)  # Clean and inspect the combined dataframe # View the first few rows of the combined dataframe head(combined_df)  # Check the structure of the combined dataframe glimpse(combined_df)

title: Create px files
text: pxmake R package creating modifying px files. pxmake can: Import PC-AXIS px file, modify , save new px file. Save px file Excel workbook. complex modifications px file, like adding total levels variable.

title: Create px files
text: Install latest version running: pxmake available CRAN.
code: # install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github('StatisticsGreenland/pxmake')

title: Create px files
text: Use px() px_save() read/write px file px object. modify px object, use pxmake’s modifying functions. general, modifying functions named keyword modify. ’s possible chain multiple modifying functions together tidyverse style using pipe operator %>%.
code: library(pxmake)  # Read px file into a px object x <- px(input = "example.px")  class(x) #> [1] "px"  # Save px object as a new px file px_save(x, path = "example2.px") library(magrittr) # import pipe  # Create px object from data frame x <- px(data.frame(year = as.character(rep(2021:2023, each = 3)),                     group = c('a', 'b', 'c'),                     value = runif(9)                    )         )   head(x$data, 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   year  group value #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 2021  a     0.266 #> 2 2021  b     0.372 #> 3 2021  c     0.573 #> 4 2022  a     0.908  x %>%    px_timeval("year") %>%  # Set year as TIMEVAL   px_heading("year") %>%  # Set year as HEADING   px_stub("group") %>%    # Set group as STUB   px_decimals("2") %>%    # Set DECIMALS to 2   px_save("example.px") # Save as px file

what: How to create a new release
title: Create px files
text: Checkout ‘main’ branch. Run usethis::use_version('major'/'minor'/'patch'). Answer ‘’ prompt ‘ok commit ?’. Update NEWS.md changes since last release. Commit changes message ‘Increment version number X.Y.Z’. Run git tag vX.Y.Z. Run git push. Run git push --tags. Run devtools::use_github_release(). Run usethis::use_version('dev'). Answer ‘Yes’ prompt ‘ok commit ?’. Run git push.

text: x px object value character vector variables add total levels . na.rm Optional. Logical. TRUE, NAs removed summing.

title: Add total levels to variables — px_add_totals
text: px object

title: Add total levels to variables — px_add_totals
code: # Create small px object example x0 <- px(subset(population_gl, age == "65+")) x0$data #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 2 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 3 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 4 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 5 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 6 female 65+   2024   2616  # Add total level to one variable x1 <- px_add_totals(x0, "gender") x1$data #> # A tibble: 9 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Total  65+   2004   3111 #> 2 Total  65+   2014   4242 #> 3 Total  65+   2024   5732 #> 4 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 5 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 6 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 7 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 8 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 9 female 65+   2024   2616  # Add total level to multiple variables x2 <- px_add_totals(x0, c("gender", "age")) x2$data #> # A tibble: 18 × 4 #>    gender age   year      n #>    <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 Total  Total 2004   3111 #>  2 Total  Total 2014   4242 #>  3 Total  Total 2024   5732 #>  4 female Total 2004   1630 #>  5 female Total 2014   2004 #>  6 female Total 2024   2616 #>  7 male   Total 2004   1481 #>  8 male   Total 2014   2238 #>  9 male   Total 2024   3116 #> 10 Total  65+   2004   3111 #> 11 Total  65+   2014   4242 #> 12 Total  65+   2024   5732 #> 13 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 14 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 15 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 16 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 17 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 18 female 65+   2024   2616  # The name of the total level is set with `px_elimination` x3 <-   x0 |>   px_elimination("T") |>   px_add_totals("gender")  x3$data #> # A tibble: 9 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 T      65+   2004   3111 #> 2 T      65+   2014   4242 #> 3 T      65+   2024   5732 #> 4 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 5 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 6 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 7 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 8 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 9 female 65+   2024   2616

code: # Set ELIMINATION for all languages x1 <-   px(population_gl) |>   px_elimination('YES')  # Print ELIMINATION px_elimination(x1) #> [1] "YES"  # Set ELIMINATION for individual variables library(tibble) x2 <-   x1 |>   px_elimination(tribble(~`variable-code`, ~elimination,                     'gender', 'All',                     'age',    'Total')) px_elimination(x2) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   `variable-code` elimination #>   <chr>           <chr>       #> 1 gender          All         #> 2 age             Total       #> 3 year            YES         #> 4 n               YES          # Set ELIMINATION for individual languages x3 <-   x2 %>%   px_languages(c('en', 'kl')) |>   px_elimination(tribble(~`variable-code`, ~language, ~elimination,                     'gender',    'en',      'All_en',                     'gender',    'kl',      'All_kl',                     'age',       'en',      'Total_en')) px_elimination(x3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   `variable-code` language elimination #>   <chr>           <chr>    <chr>       #> 1 gender          en       All_en      #> 2 gender          kl       All_kl      #> 3 age             en       Total_en     # Remove ELIMINATION x4 <- px_elimination(x3, NULL) px_elimination(x4) #> NULL

title: pxmake 0.12.0
text: Change argument ‘variable’ ‘variables’ ‘value’ px_stub(), px_heading(), px_figures(), px_timeval(), px_add_totals(), align modifying functions. (#296)

title: pxmake 0.12.0
text: Add modifying functions: px_values(), px_variable_label(), px_data(), px_source(). (#291) Add pkgdown version documentation : https://statisticsgreenland.github.io/pxmake/ Add example data sets population_gl greenlanders. (#282) px_micro() support multilingual keyword_values arguments. (#306) Add example section help pages.

title: pxmake 0.12.0
text: Update px_micro() documentation. Bugfix: px_add_totals() now uses default value ‘Total’ x$variables2$elimination NA. (#284) Add na.rm argument px_add_totalts(). px() can now take Excel workbook without ‘Data’ sheet, without requiring argument ‘data’ supplied. Remove unused functions. Add three vigenttes. (#277, #278, #280) Increase test coverage. Move px keywords internal data set. Add link Statstics Sweden’s documentation help page px keywords. Add Statistics Greenland vignette.

title: pxmake 0.11.0
text: release contains lot breaking changes. done functions name clashes popular packages. prefix ‘px_’ added almost functions avoid . massive breaking change, breaking changes made well, create intuitive naming make package consistent.

what: How to update code from before version 0.11.0
title: pxmake 0.11.0
text: Change modifying functions adding prefix px_. E.g. change stub() px_stub(), heading() px_heading(), etc. Change pxsave() px_save(). Change micromake() px_micro(). functions deprecated can longer used: metamake(), pxmake(), make_template(). Change x$codelists1 x$codelists2 x$cells1 x$cells2. Change x$acrosscell x$acrosscells. Change x$variables1$type x$variables1$variable-type. Change sheet ‘Codelists1’ ‘Codelists2’ ‘Cells1’ ‘Cells2’. Change sheet ‘Acrosscell’ ‘Acrosscells’. ‘Variables1’ sheet change column ‘type’ ‘variable-type’ . set variable TIMEVAL add new column ‘timeval’ ‘Variables1’ set ‘TRUE’. TIMEVAL can longer set type="TIME" Variables1.

title: pxmake 0.11.0
text: Rename ‘codelists’ ‘cells’ px-object Excel workbooks. (#256) Deprecate ‘metamake’, ‘pxmake’ ‘make_template’. (#198) Change name modifying functions adding prefix ‘px_’. (#254) Rename ‘acrosscell’ ‘acrosscells’. (#271) Rename type variable-type variables1. (#261) Move TIMEVAL column variables1, instead part variable-type. (#265) Rename ‘pxsave’ ‘px_save’. (#273) Rename ‘figures’ ‘px_figures’, ‘order’ ‘px_order’, ‘add_totals’ ‘px_add_totals’. (#274) Rename ‘micromake’ ‘px_mircro’.

title: pxmake 0.11.0
text: Add modifying functions: map(), baseperiod(), domain(), elimination(), descriptiondefault(), order(), precision(), cellnote(), cellnotex(), cfprices(), stockfa(), variable_type(), contvariable(). (#246) (#125) (#223) micromake() use furrr package run parallel. (#248) micromake() removes headings figures NA. (#250)

title: pxmake 0.11.0
text: Fix mistake documentation table2 modifying functions. Avoid warning caused helper function. Bugfix: cellnote() can handle empty data frame.

title: pxmake 0.10.1
text: Change modifying functions also getters, e.g. stub(x) returns current STUB variables. pxsave() automatically adds values aren’t defined codelists2. Add argument save_data pxsave() supress saving ‘Data’ sheet Excel. (#204) Add arugment data_path pxsave() save data table .rds file. (#204) Add micromake arguments control keywords invidual tables. (#239) Add possibility micromake control output filenames. (#242) Add new modifying functions: last_updated(), next_update(), language(), languages(), valuenote(), valuenotex(), contents(), description(), subject_area(), subject_code(), title(), units(), aggregallowed(), autopen(), axis_version(), codepage(), confidential(), copyright(), showdecimals(), tableid(), update-frequency(), contact(), link(), note(), notex(), infofile().

title: pxmake 0.10.1
text: Throw error trying remove mandatory keyword. (#208) Validate px using modifying functions. validate_px checks keywords table1 table2 right table. Check arguments micromake valid. Sort data creating codelist data frame. (#197) Add priority complexity list unimplemented keywords. Add check keywords correct table. Remove ‘micro’ prefix filenames created micromake(). Use documentation functions table1 table2 functions, easy change. Add test coverage badge README.md. Check defined variable-codes data. Add check data columns defined. micromake() used preserve HEADING variables, produces px files variables. Bugfix: heading(), stub() figures() longer modify order variables. (#225) Remove duplication documentaiton pivot modifying functions. Bugfix: last_updated() created wrong keyword (#233) Remove ‘micro’ prefix filenames created micromake(). Bugfix: wrong error message (#243) Bugfix: last_updated() modified wrong table. Bugfix: Remove NA values creating px file (#205). Bugfix: px(input) can path .rds file.

title: pxmake 0.10.0
text: function px() creates px object. major change way package works. pxmake metamake soft deprecated. Use px() pxsave() instead. (#197) modify px object, number modifying functions added: charset(), creation_date(), decimals(), matrix(), stub(), heading(), timeval(), add_totals() figures(). Many need added future, cover px keywords.

title: pxmake 0.10.0
text: ‘rds’ version px file completly gone. Neither pxmake() metamake() can create . pxmake() metamake() can convert Excel px files, return px object invisibly. pxmake() metamake() deprecated future. make_template() deprecated future - px() automatically creates metadata template none provided. micromake() now takes px object input. add_totals() now takes px object input.

title: pxmake 0.10.0
text: README.md rewritten, includes list keywords modifying functions. vignettes removed. README.md now created README.Rmd using knitr::knit().

title: pxmake 0.9.1
text: Add make_template create minimial multilingual metadata template. (#186) Add micromake create many small px-files large data set. See vignette(micromake). (#176) Support keyword VALUENOTE (#187)

title: pxmake 0.9.1
text: Add import pipe. (Reverses commit #d59866c) Add vignette creating px file multilingual px file. Fix edge case list mergeing. Use latin1 default encoding, add CODEPAGE=utf-8. Set maximum column width Excel. Add create_data argument metamake can supress generation data.

title: pxmake 0.9.0
text: Let metamake accept data frame input create minimal metadata template data.

title: pxmake 0.9.0
text: Handle px-files either zero heading variables zero stub variables. (#95) Fix edge case list sorting caused px-files codes. Use values codes code given add_totals variable.

title: pxmake 0.8.1
text: Use variable-code variable-label label given. (#173) Quote values text keywords even text number. (#164)

title: pxmake 0.8.0
text: Split sheet ‘Table’ two sheets language dependency. (#65) Split column ‘position’ ‘Variables’ sheet ‘pivot’ ‘order’. (#159) Check illegal values columns ‘pivot’ ‘type’ ’Variables sheet. Rename ‘variable’ ‘long_name’ ‘variable-code’ ‘variable-label’. (#144) Add check language-dependent mandatory variables Excel metadata.

title: pxmake 0.8.0
text: Return rds object invisibly pxmake metamake. (#37) Support CONTVARIABLE. (#132) Preserve name FIGURES variable data formats.

title: pxmake 0.8.0
text: Rename internal functions ‘source_data’ ‘data’. (#151) Print error message without name function threw error. Sort metadata saving.

title: pxmake 0.7.0

title: pxmake 0.7.0
text: Validate arguments pxmake metamake give helpful error messages. Support px-files without LANGUAGES keyword. (#143) Remove dependencies test run parallel. (#112) Split tests files run faster parallel. (#149) GitHub actions cancels build newer commit pushed. Lots documentation improvements.
